to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)

foot/to be sufficient/ample

shoe/to tread on

sentences.english: We mustn't cut the feet to fit the shoes.
Doing this is cutting the foot to fit the shoe.
sentences.chinese: 这样做无异于削足适履。

definition: to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature

neither fish nor fowl/resembling nothing on earth
to follow in other people's footsteps
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it

definition: to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
